Message.Title: (((MANY EXAMPLES WHERE AMD HIT LOWS AND RALLIED 224% - 509%)))
Message.Msg: This cycle happen every few years, 2012 is the 3rd years. look for a huge run in 2013. Oct 90 - $1.94 May 92 - $6.75 Gain of 347% 7 months Jun 92 - $4.375 May 93 - $14.31 Gain of 327% 11 months Jul 96 - $6.065 Apr 97 - $21.25 Gain of 350% 9 months Sep 99 - $8.595 Apr 00 - $43.75 Gain of 509% 7 months Dec 00 - $13.81 Apr 01 - $31 Gain of 224% 4 months Feb 03 - $5.49 Nov 03 - $17.97 Gain of 327% 9 months Apr 05 - $14.23 Jan 06 - $41.80 Gain of 293% 9 months Feb 09 - $2.18 Dec 09 - $9.68 Gain of 440% 10 months On 11-23-12 AMD was beat down buy short selling to $1.87. Today it closed UP @ $2.59. UP 40% SINSE NOVEMBER. LIKE RIMM, AMD was beat down bad and is coming back. RIMM rallied UP almost 300% in the last 3 months. LOOK for history to repeat for AMD. We are still are near the bottom. We have CES next months and earnings that are expected to beat estimites.

Topic.Title: Nvidia says Intel's Xeon Phi helps it win new business

Message.Msg: Wow! A Huge Huge WIN for those energy efficient Intel Xeon Phi chips! Intel has won the #1 Fastest Supercomputer on the Planet. THE #1, boys. Let's read excerpts about how 200,000 Intel parts will exclusively power THE Fastest, Most Powerful Supercomputer in the History of Mankind, shall we? "Sometimes in the next 18 months, Intel will power the world's most powerful supercomputer. Consisted of approximately 100,000 Ivy Bridge-EP based Xeon E5's and 100,000 Xeon Phi boards (Knights Landing), the Chinese supercomputer should be the world's most powerful, reaching no less than 100 PFLOPS of compute power. ... the supercomputer should reach 100 PFLOPS, approximately 10 times faster than the fastest supercomputer in 2011 and five times faster than the current fastest supercomputer. This project is heavily backed by the Chinese government and Ministry of Sciences, viewed as the system needed to aid the China space exploration, as well as rising the health research to a new degree. The government sees that within the next couple of decades, it will have to start battling the older population, predict where to build cities, calculate the highway system (by 2020, China plans to build more new highways than the current total in the United States, for example - and have twice as much highways than U.S. by 2030), public transportation system as well as wild projects such as intelligent license plates, real time traffic calculation to suggest preferred speed to reduce stoppages on the roads etc. ... this will be the fastest supercomputer for some time. ... the Chinese supercomputer will be a majestic rig indeed, with over 200,000 pieces of silicon processing weather simulations, calculating Chinese space projects (manned missons to the Moon by 2020, Mars by 2025), and many more. ... Intel will earn some nice dollars off the special warranty arrangements." Intel will power the #1 Fastest Super computer on the Planet. "THIS will be the fastest supercomputer for some time." 10 times faster than the fastest supercomputer in 2011. Using over 200,000 pieces of Intel designed and manufactured silicon. Looks like Intel has done it again, boys. Killed-off yet another one of nvidia's litte businesses. Tesla accelerator chips.

Message.Title: T4 is so late, it is really DOA
Message.Msg: everybody's beating nvda to quad A15 by a long shot, aapl, samsung, qcom..... There will be nothing left for T4 by the time it comes to market. Since it is so late, and it is not the latest, it won't even made it into Nexus anything. For example, aapl is going to have a new iPad with retina display in March, I bet you $ to donut that will have quad A15s - ala beating T4 tablets to market by a minimum of 6 to 9 months minimum. Way too late for bleeding edge, not enough integration for anything less than that (eg. brcm got their nfc stack to be part of Android). nvda should shutter Tegra and just license their graphics.

Topic.Title: T4 is so late, it is really DOA

Message.Msg: How very wrong. Apple is reportedly using a ARMv7 core of their own design. It falls somewhere in performance between the A9 and A15. It's difficult to judge the relative power efficiency because of their closed OS. Qualcomm is also using a core of their own design, "Krait". Qualcomm's designs started out being measurably below the same-era ARM Holdings designs, and they initially appeared to have wasted their investment. But by sticking with their internal design team they were able to bring out a A15 class processor earlier than vendors waiting on ARM. Samsung was the first with the actual A15 with the dual core Exynos 5 in the Nexus 10. Actually the Arndale board was the first announced, but you couldn't get those until the Nexus 10 was on the shelves. It appears that Nvidia will be the first with a quad core A15. We can expect that Samsung will have an equivalent quad core Exynos 5 sometime in early spring.

Message.Title: case study to prove 4+1 advantage
Message.Msg: Nvidia made a lot of fuss about 4+1 design but by all accounts its just not any better than dynamic clocking approach in Snapdragon. T4 will be the first opportunity to compare apples to apples with S4. Has anyone seen a case study where companion core provides significant differentiation ? I also saw that Microsoft Surface is not even using the companion core - I guess they didn't want to mess around with process schedulers in kernel for Nvidia.

Topic.Title: Ouya - oh yeah

Message.Msg: lets assume that you are correct - how big do you believe this market is? Given how Nvidia has been publicly bashing game controller market - I think there is a chance that they are not pursuing and being used in any of the upcoming refresh xbox, PS (wiiu already is public with amd) If these $99 devices can push 10M+ units per year then Nvidia strategy of staying focused on Tegra SOC would pay off. I think T4 will need to aim for at least 50M sales in 2013 - that's a 66% increase over 2012. This will keep Nvidia at $4B/Year revenue level as I do see pressure on GPU segment with Intel Haswell. Of course, profit margin will be negatively impacted if GPU segment revenue is being offset by CPB segment.

The new GPUs just keep raising the bar... and last report, INtel drivers can now run 100 games... Pressure will be in 2yrs on the x86 segment from ARM64...

Topic.Title: case study to prove 4+1 advantage

Message.Msg: Microsoft isn't using the 5th core because their software isn't mature. They wanted to keep a vendor-neutral software interface, yet expected the vendors to go all out to support and improve their unproven platform. That works in the desktop world, but not when they are struggling to hit 1%. The companion core approach is a great solution, but it doesn't address the power consumed by the rest of the system off of the SoC. I would say the bigger advantage is that is avoids the big.LITTLE approach, which is difficult to schedule for. By the time the Android Linux kernel gets good at simultaneously using asymmetrical cores, the next hardware generation will be here.

Topic.Title: Ouya - oh yeah

Message.Msg: well the HDD controller makers were all saying the same thing about SSD and see how quickly that changed - of course, floods in Thailand helped... its a no-brainer that one of these days, Intel GPU will be accepted as good enough. Just look at MBP 13" - it provides Pixel whatever with Intel solution. You are in denial if you think GPU business as standalone has any future. If Nvidia was thinking about shareholder interests - they would sell or, scale back and start licensing etc. The stock would be at $20+. However, I have on good authority that Nvida top management is mediocre and delusional. I am counting on that.
